boardgame.description: Gambit Royale, first released under the name Ruse _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;amp; Bruise, is a fast-paced card game in the tradition of Citadels. Magicians and dragons, kings and princesses populate the land and want only one thing: the greatest fame. The players try to use their royal household to cause problems for their opponents and trick them with underhanded chess moves._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;In more detail, the game lasts six rounds, and at the start of each round, each player reveals a random goal card worth 1-5 victory points (VPs), each with one of six symbols printed on it. Each player has a deck of influence cards and starts with a hand of three cards. On a turn, a player plays a card face down in front of a goal card, then draws a replacement card; if a face-down card is already present at this goal, the player reveals in and executes the action on it, if any. As soon as all goals have as many cards below them as their VP value, the round ends. Reveal the face-down cards without executing their actions, then carry out the actions of any mercenaries, wizards, witches, and princes/squires in play. Whichever player then has the most influence on a goal (as determined by the values on their played cards) claims that goal, with ties being broken in favor of whichever tied player played on that goal first._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;After six rounds, players tally their goal cards to determine their final score; alternatively, if they have a set of six goal symbols, they can sum those six cards, double that value, then subtract 1 VP from that total for each goal card they have that's not part of that set. Whoever has the most points wins!_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The 2018 edition of Gambit Royale contains five more cards than the first edition of Ruse _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;amp; Bruise._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2007 Golden Geek Best Card Game Nominee

listing.notes: We only sell brand new, shrinkwrapped games. International shipping available. Edition: Rio Grande Games (2006) RIO 309
Played a couple of times.

Rio Grande Games (RIO 309) Type: Card Games Number of players: 2-6 Age of players: 8+ Length: 30 minutes Game Description: Ruse _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; Bruise is a game that is easy to learn, but is always changing. Players employ witches, alchemists, assassins, kings, traders, and others to earn good reputations in their fields of endeavor; but the players must protect them from certain attacks of the other players.Take those attacks from the others in stride; you can and will return each in kind and wipe the smiles from their faces...until their next attacks. Author: Lutz Stepponat
Played a few times but in excellent condition

Still in shrinkwrap. I prefer paypal, but will also accept check or money order (though it will be slower). I ship by USPS parcel post with delivery confirmation. If you order several games from me, I will combine shipping.

Game complete and in good condition. Some small amount of wear showing on the box, but the components are in great condition. Shipping for this game will be $8 via USPS priority mail. I am getting ready to move so I have a number of games for sale. Please check out my other listings. I am more than willing to combine shipping to save you money if you buy more than one game. Please contact me with any questions.

The rate structure for those boxes is as follows: Shipping for games that will fit within a 8.5_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; X 5.25_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; X 1.5_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; box costs $4.95. I can easily combine shipping if games will fit within these boxes. If they don_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t, I can still combine shipping, but that is a little tricker. Thursdays are the days I get most of my shipping done, if that helps you.

Rio Grande Games (RIO309F) Ruse _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; Bruise is a game that is easy to learn, but yet difficult to master. Players employ witches, alchemists, assassins, kings, traders, and other characters to earn good reputations in their fields of endeavor; however the players must protect the characters in their employ from the certain attacks made by other players. Take those attacks from the others in stride; you can and will return each in kind wiping the smiles from their faces... until their next attack.
